<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 16"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Portentous Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=6083) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=647" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=817" />
<trait label="Spellshape" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=513" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=727" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 143 <sup>1.1</sup>

</column>

---

Your spellcasting is rife with strange lights, mild fumes, and other captivating effects that befuddle your foes. If the next action you use is to [Cast a Spell](/Actions.aspx?ID=2734), any creature that attempts to use a reaction triggered by your Cast a Spell activity takes a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls and skill checks rolled as part of the reaction. In addition, if the spell includes a spell attack or requires a saving throw, creatures you hit or that fail their saves are [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=72) with you until the start of your next turn.
name: Portentous Spell
